page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: A retired clergyman living in Rhyd-y-croesau was closely involved with the local history group. He had many stories to tell.{Legend}has it that during the civil war in 1643 {Charles ll}and his troops were spending the night somewhere near Rhyd_y_croesau. In order to foil his enemy (the{(Parliamentarians)}the King led his men on a road which passed through what is now part of the garden of Milkwood cottage at Rhydycroesau. Another story told of English and Welsh armies battling each side of the stream beside Milkwood cottage. The English were losing so they tied their red coats to the bushes. While the Welsh were still firing at the coats the English crept behind them, thus surprising the Welsh and winning the battle.
